quizzes.question: What value of the "display" property makes the inline element act as a blocking level element?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]display: block[/h1] Every element on a web page is a rectangular box.The [b]display [/b]property determines how that rectangular box behaves. A block element is an element that takes up the fullest width available, with line breaks before and after. The style rules in the following example display the inline elements as block-level elements: [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]First paragraph. Second paragraph. Third paragraph. Fourth paragraph. Fifth paragraph.[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="562"]span { [b]display: block[/b]; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2647" width="100%"]
